title: Update HarfBuzz 2.5.2
body:

On Linux the compiler seems to have issues. Can we use clang to build HarfBuzz?
@mattleibow

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body:
@Gillibald We can and probably should.
But, I see 2.5.2 has fixes for GCC 4.8 - so that might fix it.

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body: In that case, we can switch to clang. I don't think there is a real preference for compilers.

comments.author: Gillibald
comments.body: Looks like the current Android compiler doesn't like C++11

comments.author: Gillibald
comments.body: Linux and Android are blocked by compiler. For Mac projects need an update I can't do.

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body:
I switched to using clang for both Linux and Android, and then upgraded the Android build to C++11.
I also added the files to the xcode projects. Let's see how this goes...

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body: @Gillibald I think we are good to merge. Let me know if you spot anything that I missed.
